body.p:
Whitley County
State of Kentucky
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlet
Gov of Kentucky

Your Petitioner James H. Moore, would most respectfully represent, that on the 4th day of July 1865 in the Town of Williamsburg, a number of Discharged Soldiers from the Union Army meet to selebrate the day with many Citizens -- Myself one of the Soldiers

That our Friends being glad to see us on such an occasion from their many and Earnest solicitations we took a few drinks too many. A little noise and Confusion was the result no licks struck -- no person hurt -- and all was soon quiet --
Your Petitioner was arrested by an officer and tried fined the sum of $10 -- and cost about $

Your Petitioner would states that he is a poor man of family and that it would be oppressive on him at this time to have it to pay that He has had Every Thing that Himself and family have lived on to buy since He left the Service --

He would therefore in consideration of the forgoing statement of Facts most Earnestly and respectfully
ask a remission of the aforesaid fine -- Your petitioner promises that for the future He will not again be guilty

The undersigned citizens of Whitley County say that they are acquainted with the Petitioner James H. Moore That they believe the Statements in His Petition are substantially true And Respectfully ask that His fine be remitted
